column5: Anyone fish Lake Gueguen near Val-D'Or? Up there a ways, but looking for a new walleye/pike lake.
do you possibly mean the gouin reservoir (pronounced "gwin")? - phish

Lake Gueguen is located straight north of Toronto (approx 450KM)It is a beautiful location and has several lakes connected that may be fished. Walleye fishing is very good and large pike are not uncommon. A friend of mine and his Brother went there several years back and were very pleased with all aspects of the area.
No, GueGuen is close to Val-D'Or, I think further north than Gouin.
Lac Guéguen is approximately: a. 40 km east of Val D'Or b. 20 km south and 160 km west of the Gouin Reservoir. Google search identified one outfitter - see http://www.pavillonlacgueguen.com/
retire55, Have you been there? Is the lake close to civilization, a bush road?

No, I haven't been there myself. However, I'll be driving right by it next year as I have a walleye trip planned for an area about 100 miles north east of this lake. Lac Guéguen is maybe 13 miles east of a major north south highway (117) in Quebec. Here's a web version of the topo map that includes Lac Guéguen http://toporama.cits.rncan.gc.ca/ima.../03/032c03.gif Once it opens, click anywhere to get exploded view. You could also use Google Earth to view the area.
